data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take the 9th step forward to go forward to the next step. Take the 7th step left to go forward to the next step. Take the 8th step backward to go backward to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This statement is not proper in order to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You have to take 6 steps to get back to the starting point. You have to take 4 steps to get back to the starting point. The answer: yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The original directions were to take 1 step. Turn left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps. Take 5 steps. Turn around and take 5 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turning upside down is done with a turn op on either side of your body. So in the diagram on the left, you would turn around left. In the diagram on the right, you would turn around right. So in the diagram on the left, you would turn around right. So in the diagram on the right, you would turn around right. So in the diagram on the left, you would turn around right. So in the diagram on the right, you would turn around right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Turn right a third time. Take 8 steps. take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 6 different steps you can take to get to the starting point. The number of steps you should take to get where you started is 8 different steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When facing forward, you can always face away from your starting point. Forward step, left step, ahead step, back step must be right angles. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return back to the starting point, you would take the following steps: Take one step 1 step 2 steps 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

You cannot always face forward. Only when there are more steps forward can one look backward. So, the answer is yes.

To go backward, you always face forward and take the steps as you normally would. If you go forward, you always face forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If the first instruction is taken from the starting point, you'll always start by facing forward. The answer: No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If the instructions are followed, you always face forward except when you are in a race and on the track in traffic. If you face the wrong direction every time you are on the track, you will always go to the wrong side of the track. As you are face forward, you take 3 steps forward. The first step right after the first step is to take 1 step right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

To return to the starting point, you’ d have to take 6 steps left. The start should be face forward. So, the answer is No.

Turn around to the left. Repeat this sequence.

Assuming that the instructions were meant to turn around and return to the starting point, the answer is no.

Take 9 steps towards the starting point. Take 7 steps to turn around and turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 4 total steps in the directions you take. If you started from 1 then you will be back in start direction. If you turned around 1 then you will be back in right direction. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right and follow the instructions in order to return to the starting point. If you assume the number 6, you would return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The last two steps are the ones to turn left. If the first four steps are taken, the third one would be at the previous step. So, the answer is No.

You have to have a starting point and a returning point in order to receive the 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

This is a more direct way of doing this since 3 steps would be the first 3 steps taken. If you take 3 steps, you are back where you were standing. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person can only take 7 steps of moving forward and if they only have 8 steps they can only take 2 steps of moving backward. In order to take 11 steps you have to take 7 steps left, 2 steps right, 5 steps backward, 7 steps forward, 1 step backward, and 1 step forward. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you do not need to take 7 steps backwards. If you take 9 steps left you will get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

After the circle is complete, turn around and take 4 steps back. So, the answer is yes.

You will always take the same number of steps in the same direction. The number of steps will become the same in both directions. Return to starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

The location of the starting point is curved, so taking 5 steps to turn around is only part of the process. So, the answer is Yes.

When you’ retracing your steps, you must start by facing forward. When you step backward you must take two steps forward and when you take 3 steps backward you must take 6 steps forward. When you say you were facing forward you had to face backward to get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You always take fewer steps when determining the initial point. Take one step takes one set of steps or several steps but fewer in number. You usually take one step back when doing the first steps. So, the answer is Yes.

They tell you to always face forward. So, the answer is No.

You can only make your way backward by facing forward and taking 5 steps left. Also, you must take 5 steps right at the same time you take 1 steps backward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The first stage of this process can be completed only in one position and never in two. The last stage of this process can only be completed in two positions and never in three, and the last stage can only be completed in one position and never in none. All of the steps to begin a movement in this sequence are to be taken facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

There are times when one should return to the starting point. These 2 directions are not the same. So, the answer is no.

Face forward makes one invincible. If you start backward, you can't move forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can turn around a bicycle. It’s the opposite way around. Not everyone is going to a starting point and they are going to turn right or left. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is usually facing to the right. If you always face the right way, you can’t take 10 steps backwards. The starting point always faces forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you can only go from right to left, you cannot go back to the starting point. If you are using that method, the starting point will not be facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The point or starting point is facing forward. You start a sequence of progressions for the motion. Step right takes 4 steps right. Step 4 steps right is the last step. Step 4 steps left is the last step. Step 8 steps left is the first step. Step 6 steps right is the first step. Step 9 steps right is the last step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is either on the left or on the right. If you take the 9 steps, you travel back to the starting point. If you take the 3 steps, you travel back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 9 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step to this would be either taking six steps right or taking 9 steps left. The other steps would be either taking 5 steps left or taking 8 steps right. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 5 steps backward. Take 2 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If someone always faces forward, they will always take 4 steps left for a complete 180-degree turn to the right. Otherwise, they will always take 5 steps backward for a complete 180-degree turn to the left. To take 5 steps backward, one would take 4 steps left and 5 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In order to return backward, you have to take 2 steps backward. In order to return to to start with, you have to take 4 steps left. In order to go forward, you have to take 2 steps forward. In order to go right, you have to take 7 steps right. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Reversing an order is the opposite of turning left. Turning left is the opposite of turning right. So, the answer is No.
